card_answer:
###When people or things are apart, they are not next to each other.

---

_They moved apart and then came back together._

###An attribute is a characteristic of a person or thing.

---

_He isn’t very clever, but he does have some other positive attributes._

###A bilingual person can speak two languages.

---

_Since you already know English, after learning French you’ll be bilingual._

###Something completely different is very, very different from before.

---

_I was completely wrong._

###To dash means to run or move quickly.

---

_Helen dashed up the stairs so she wouldn’t be late for her appointment._

###Disgust is a feeling of distaste and anger caused by something rude or unpleasant.

---

_He felt disgust toward his date because she had such terrible eating habits._

###Something fashionable is what people like to wear and do now.

---

_It is very fashionable to wear a hat._

###Something foreign is something we are not used to.

---

_He has travelled widely in foreign countries._

###A gulf is a gap between people who do not understand each other.

---

_There has been a gulf between James and Tony since their parents died._

###A mirror is usually made of glass, and you can see yourself in it.

---

_He used the mirror to shine light in their eyes._

###Things that are natural are not made by people.

---

_We need to take care of the natural world._

###Nowadays means at the present time.

---

_Nowadays, not so many people smoke._

###A participant is someone who joins in a social event or competition.

---

_There were thousands of participants in this year’s marathon._

###A ritual is a formal custom that people do regularly.

---

_Ken was very interested to learn about the religious rituals of the natives._

###Spoken language is what we say.

---

_We cannot take back what has been spoken._

###Sport involves games like running, jumping, football, and tennis.

---

_She loves watching sport on TV._

###You are surprised when something unexpected happens.

---

_He didn’t appear at all surprised when he read the article._

###When you are tense, you are not comfortable and feel unhappy.

---

_I felt very tense waiting to hear the result of the vote._

###If you totally agree, you agree with everything just said.

---

_I am totally against that._

###If something is vague, it is not clear and gives very few details.

---

_I asked him about his mother’s health, but he was very vague about it._

###To allow something to happen means to let it happen.

---

_Having a ticket will allow you to enter the show._

###To announce something is to make it known.

---

_He announced to everyone his new idea for the company._

###Someone or something beside you is next to you.

---

_The two brothers stood beside each other._

###A challenge is something difficult to complete.

---

_It was a challenge to climb to the top of the mountain._

###To claim means to say that something is true.

---

_He claimed to know why the country’s laws were weak._

###The condition of someone or something is the state that they are in.

---

_The patient’s condition was very good._

###To contribute to something means to do something to make it successful.

---

_We decided to contribute money to the new hospital._

###A difference is a way that something is not like other things.

---

_The biggest difference between the birds is the color of their feathers._

###To divide something is to split it into smaller parts.

---

_We divided the pizza._

###An expert is someone who is very good at doing something.

---

_The wizard was an expert at magic._

###A famous person or thing is well known.

---

_The Eiffel Tower in Paris is very famous._

###Force is a person’s strength or power.

---

_He used all his force to try and open the door._

###To cause harm is to hurt someone or damage something.

---

_A hot iron can cause great harm if you are not careful._

###To lay means to put or place in a horizontal or flat position.

---

_Don’t lay your socks on the floor._

###Peace is a time without war.

---

_A white dove is a symbol of peace._

###A prince is the son of a king.

---

_The prince and the princess were married._

###To protect someone is to stop them from getting hurt.

---

_Firemen protect us from fires._

###To sense something is to know about it without being told.

---

_I could sense that he was watching me._

###When something is sudden, it happens very quickly.

---

_He felt a sudden pain in his chest._

###Therefore means for this reason.

---

_He is fat. Therefore, he should go on a diet._

###To accept something that is offered is to take it.

---

_I accepted the girl’s very nice gift._

###To arrange things is to put them in the right place.

---

_Please arrange the words in order from A to Z._

###To attend something is to go to it.

---

_My sister and I attend the same school._

###You chase people when you run after them and try to catch them.

---

_I was chased by a dog._

###A contrast is a sharp difference between two things.

---

_The contrast between my parents is very noticeable._

###To encourage people is to make them want to do something.

---

_My football coach will encourage us when we are losing._

###People or things familiar to you are those you know well.

---

_The two friends were very familiar with each other._

###To grab is to take a hold of someone or something suddenly.

---

_I grabbed a pear from the tree._

###To hang something is to keep it above the ground.

---

_I drew a picture of my family, and my mother hung it on the wall._

###If something is huge, it is very big.

---

_At work, my father drives a huge truck._

###If something is necessary, you must do it.

---

_A passport is necessary if you travel to other countries._

###A pattern is a way in which something is done or organized.

---

_My pattern of brushing my teeth is the same as most people’s._

###To propose something is to say that it should be done.

---

_My grandmother proposed that we have our picture taken with Santa._

###A purpose is the reason that you do something.

---

_The purpose of exercising is to get into shape._

###To release something is to stop holding it.

---

_She released the bird from her hands._

###To require something is to say that it is necessary.

---

_We require teachers to have a university degree._

###You are satisfied when you have what you wanted.

---

_I am very satisfied with your work._

###If something is single, then there is only one.

---

_I have a single key in my hand._

###To tear something means to pull it apart.

---

_It is easy to tear paper._

###A theory is an idea about how something works.

---

_We talked about Einstein’s theory of relativity in class._

###An animal is a living thing that can move.

---

_My favorite animal is the panda._

###A bus is a large vehicle that people travel on.

---

_My father takes the bus to work._

###A cat is a small animal related to lions and tigers that is kept as a pet.

---

_This cat is playing with a ball._

###A command is an order given to a person or animal to do something.

---

_Joe gave the students a command to stand up._

###To depend on something is to need it for support or help.

---

_My grandfather depends on a cane when he walks._

###A dog is an animal with four legs and a tail that is kept as a pet or trained to work.

---

_This woman’s best friend is her dog._

###A door is an object that swings or slides open and shut.

---

_Can you close the door, please?_

###A friend is someone a person knows and likes spending time with.

---

_Brian’s friend is very sad._

###To hear is to be aware of sound through your ears.

---

_Michelle cannot hear what you are saying._

###To help is to do something that makes something easier for someone else.

---

_Jane can help Nathan climb up the rock._

###A horse is a big, strong animal that people ride and use for pulling heavy things.

---

_I went to a farm and saw a horse._

###A hospital is where sick or hurt people receive care or treatment.

---

_The doctor talks to a patient at the hospital._

###A leg is a body part used for standing and walking.

---

_She hurt her leg._

###Medical means related to the treatment of an injury or disease.

---

_Tyler is a medical student studying to become a doctor._

###To open is to move something so that an opening is not covered.

---

_Amy likes to open the window to let fresh air in._

###To pull is to hold onto something to move it toward you.

---

_The children pull the rope._

###A rabbit is a small animal with long ears that lives in a hole in the ground.

---

_Look at the rabbit in the park._

###A school is a place where children go to learn.

---

_The students study at school._

###To see is to use your eyes to look at something or someone.

---

_Steven does not want to see the scary picture._

###Service is the act of helping or serving someone.

---

_This coffee shop has excellent service._

###A benefit is a good thing.

---

_Being able to fly is a benefit to birds._

###If you are certain about something, you know it is true.

---

_I am certain that zebras have stripes._

###A chance is an opportunity to do something.

---

_I had a chance to see the Coliseum in Rome last summer._

###An effect is a change made by something else.

---

_The medicine had a good effect on the boy._

###If something is essential, it is very important and necessary.

---

_It is essential to have oxygen when you scuba dive._

###If something is far, it is not close.

---

_It’s far from the east coast to the west coast of America._

###To focus on something is to think about it and pay attention to it.

---

_My mom always helps me to focus on my school work._

###The function of something is what it does.

---

_The function of a flashlight is to help you see in the dark._

###Grass is the green leaves that cover the ground.

---

_The grass looked so soft and green._

###To guard something is to take care of it.

---

_The police officer will guard us from any harm._

###The image of something is a picture of it.

---

_The image of her eye was very clear._

###If something is immediate, it happens quickly.

---

_An immediate response came from the pizza place._

###If something is primary, it is the most important thing.

---

_His primary thoughts are about money._

###People who feel proud are happy about what they have done.

---

_She is proud of the picture she drew of her house._

###To remain somewhere is to stay there.

---

_My sister had to remain home since she was sick._

###To rest is to stop being active while the body gets back its strength.

---

_I rested on the couch after work._

###If two things are separate, they are not together.

---

_New York and Los Angeles are in two separate parts of America._

###A site is a place.

---

_We found the perfect site for our picnic._

###A tail is a part of an animal’s body that sticks out from its rear or back.

---

_Our dog wags its tail when it’s happy._

###Trouble is a problem or a difficulty.

---

_I have trouble working with my boss._
